channel.title: People, leadership and the workplace in the Intelligence Age
channel.description: People, leadership and the workplace in the Intelligence Age

item.title: What will artificial intelligence mean for the world of work?
item.description:
What will artificial intelligence mean for the world of work?

What can scientists tell us about business? I had an opportunity to consider this important question when, earlier this year, I led a debate with four professors from the University of California, Berkeley, who were experts in artificial intelligence, neuroscience and psychology.

item.title: The Shift to Augmented Intelligence and How it Helps Your Organization
item.description:
The Shift to Augmented Intelligence and How it Helps Your Organization

At this year's Gartner BI and Analytics Summit, Brainspace founder and CEO, Dave Copps, spoke about the present technological shift to augmented intelligence. In the past, the focus for companies was to manage the abundance of their data and knowledge using technology which simply stored and organized it.

item.title: Man and machine are a winning team in the workplace - raconteur.net
item.description:
Man and machine are a winning team in the workplace - raconteur.net

When boffins at Oxford University and management consultants Deloitte published a joint study, which forecast that over the next ten to twenty years 35 per cent of UK jobs are at high risk of automation by machines with artificial intelligence, it sent frissons of fear down many people's spines.

item.title: What Is Intelligence Augmentation (IA)?
item.description:
What Is Intelligence Augmentation (IA)?

Intelligence augmentation (IA) is the deliberate enhancement of human intelligence using some technological means, such as eugenics, gene therapy, brain-computer interfaces, nootropics (smart drugs), neuroengineering, or some other means that hasn't been invented yet. Occasionally, the term is used to refer to external aids such as pen and paper or the Internet, but more frequently refers to permanent modifications to the brain that upgrade human intelligence.

item.title: How We Talk About Artificial Intelligence Must Change
item.description:
How We Talk About Artificial Intelligence Must Change

Some AI proponents argue that Artificial Intelligence will usurp human intelligence or even make us obsolete. That kind of talk must stop, before we lose control of AI. Artificial Intelligence (AI) is one of the leading Internet trends of 2016, particularly with large companies like Google and Facebook pouring resources into it.

item.title: The rise of augmented intelligence - raconteur.net
item.description:
The rise of augmented intelligence - raconteur.net

There's no denying the hype surrounding artificial intelligence or AI. Most weeks will feature a media story questioning whether machines are set to take over the world and give rise to another industrial revolution.

item.title: The Artificial Intelligence vs. Intelligence Augmentation Debate
item.description:
The Artificial Intelligence vs. Intelligence Augmentation Debate

A year ago, Tesla [NASDAQ: TSLA] CEO Elon Musk and Cambridge physicist Stephen Hawking created a stir as prominent signatories of an open letter warning about the dangers of artificial intelligence (AI) and the need for concerted efforts in the research community to guide AI towards socially beneficial outcomes.

item.title: How AI Will Serve Us in the Workplace
item.description:
How AI Will Serve Us in the Workplace

We're on the brink of a new industrial revolution. The plummeting cost of computing power coupled with the rising commodification of machine learning is ushering in a new age of artificial intelligence (AI) in business.

item.title: AI will transform 'massive swaths' of the workplace, LinkedIn's co-founder says
item.description:
AI will transform 'massive swaths' of the workplace, LinkedIn's co-founder says

Artificial intelligence is going to transform "massive swaths" of the workplace, LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman said Thursday. And its effects will be felt beyond sectors like manufacturing and energy, reaching into professional spheres like doctors, lawyers and financial analysts, he said. "It could have very positive effects, but it has very dynamic effects.

item.title: I, Robot: Organizational Design, Artificial Intelligence and Your Workplace
item.description:
I, Robot: Organizational Design, Artificial Intelligence and Your Workplace

In a recent blog, we wrote about the emerging trend to "virtual", for teams, workplaces, and entire organizations. In today's blog, we go further, look forward, and explore another driver of change in tomorrow's workplace - the increasing adoption of robotic and artificially intelligent systems and applications, and the implications of this trend for organizational design and the role of HR.
